Netflix seems to have completely overlooked the "cut the cord" movement. People spend a little more on Internet to have the bandwidth to stream affordable services like Netflix and Sling, but with their new price hikes it's kind of negating the benefit of cutting the cord with your local cable providers. Their argument will be that they are investing in new original content justifying the price. My argument is who cares. It's about saving money and they've lost touch with a large base of their subscribers. Hopefully these new competing services coming on line will keep that in mind when pricing their offerings.

Terrible app.  For starters it automatically signs you into the account your other amazon apps are using.  Those accounts don't have prime so it's a nuisance. Second there are no profiles, the homescreen shows everything so it's not family friendly.  Yes, there are parental controls, but a lot of these titles I don't even want my kids to see the title/cover, let alone knowing they even exist.  Needless to say, I can't hand my kids the tablet and ask them to find a show. Third, there is no chromecast support.  In order to cast you have to mirror your device's screen.  You can't use that device for anything else while you're watching something, you can't even turn its screen off because that will turn the video off on whatever your casting it to. All in all, if Amazon Prime Video wants to compete with Netflix, then the least they can do is add these very basic features.  I would cancel my netflix in a heartbeat if this app had these things.
